intro: Panicum alcobense, commonly known as the Alcobend grass, is a perennial grass species native to the tropical and subtropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender,丛生 (tufted) growth habit and narrow, linear leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed sites. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
